comment: this class is what you think college classes are like when you're in highschool. an unnecessary amount of busy work due in the class, however it is easy. so if you good with that, no problem. 1 midterm and 1 final. so easy on those. professor provides study guide that exactly matches the exams. professor is a bit hands off, but easy class to take
There are a lot of little assignments that were mildly annoying but not too difficult.  Study and go to class and you'll do fine.

Take her! She's an amazing professor and cares for your concerns. Weekly quizzes all answers are word for word from the textbook. Gives extra credit! Does take attendance. Most class work is group work! Overall she makes the class really fun and easy.

One of the best people: both as a person and as a professor. Highly understanding and empathetic towards their students. Everything learned (on and off the quizzes) are in the textbook word-for-word, so no excuse not to pass. Weekly quizzes and most assignments are group work, so be aware of that.
They are a very understanding professor. You can find the textbook, which you need for tests and quizzes, online for free. They're assignments are very fair and easy to complete.
Great Professor, Always makes class somewhat enjoyable which is good because attendance is 30% of your grade but other than that everything else is open note quizzes/exams.

I love professor Cabage. Their lectures were always the highlight of my day and were easy to understand. They are also just a genuinely caring person and loves their students. It's an easy class but don't forget to turn in the work each week.

The class it self had difficult work, however she is very understanding. If you struggling she will make her self available to help finish homework. There are a lot of homework and in class assignments, which she goes over in class. She also set up individual meeting times to help with final paper.

Professor Cabage is super understanding. She is very easy going and has a lot of knowledge. There are weekly assignments that are straight forward. If you are struggling with assignments she will offer help if you reach out.

Easiest class at KSU for my first semester. She had quizzes and test both online with no lockdown and open book open note. Tests had no time limit so you could come back to it later. Quiz answers came directly from online textbook. She did have assignments but they all were fairly easy. Compared to other cj teachers, by far easiest A

I would 100% recommend this class to anyone. Prof. was super sweet and the class was fairly really easy. The lectures were interesting and all of the homework could be done in less than 30 minutes. I absolutely loved this class and the teacher.

This class was really easy. There is a lot of homework and weekly quizzes, but none of it is too hard. The quizzes and tests are all online and are open notes. She offers some extra credit opportunities as well. Her lectures aren't that bad and are pretty interesting. Overall, I highly recommend taking Professor Cabage if you have the chance.

Professor Cabage is very understanding and makes her class very easy to pass as long as you show up and do the work. She gives multiple attempts on quizzes and drops your 3 lowest attendance, quiz, and homework grades at the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Class is easy more assignments than normal classes but they are easy and help boost grades. She lectures by PowerPoint but records them and posts them for review. Also, a lot of videos are played. Weekly quizzes are 10 questions open book and notes. She is reasonable about attendance and understanding.

Professor Cabage is always available to answer questions, clarify any confusion, and is understanding of personal matters that may interfere with deadlines. The lectures and assignments are easy to understand and not difficult if you take thorough notes.

took foundations of criminal justice very nice and offered extra credit weekly quizzes and about 2-3 homework a week Never spent more than an hour a week on work No papers, only midterm and final tests Midterm covers first half final covers second half, quiz question makes up those tests Very nice easy A but attendance goes towards grade TAKE HER
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: At first she was fine. She would get grades in as she claimed, in her syllabus, she would and answer emails. This all changed after the second week in the semester. She stopped grading assignments and has completely disregarded my emails. Her assignments are sloppy and not at all thought out. If you have an IEP do not take this teacher!

I took her online class and it wasnt bad. Lots of assignments, but theyre easy. Weekly quizzes are straight from the textbook. Midterm and final exam. Everything is open book.. She does a homework pass. if you use it, you only get 3 points added to your grade. If you dont use it, you get 5 points added to your grade

While she did assign quite a few assignments, the assignments took less than 20 minutes and weren't difficult at all. Everything is open note including the midterm and exam! Find or buy the book because it has all the answers and is useful!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Definitely a good choice if you're looking for a class that won't take up too much of your time. While there are a lot of assignments compared to other classes, they're relatively easy and require little to no extra effort or brainpower. There is a wealth of information in the course if you choose to look for it, if not you'll still be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Cabage is super nice. There are a lot of assignments, but theyre easy enough and shes not a harsh grader. As long as you put in the effort, youll be fine. There are weekly quizzes, and the test questions are taken directly from the quizzes. Everything is open book. Easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: Enjoyed this class. This professor was very responsive to our emails, class reading were very interesting and the work is not hard as long as you read the articles and watch the videos.

Assigns like 10 articles every week. Quizzes are hard and test-like, no multiple choice. Exams are all essay questions. At the beginning was good on timely grading and announcements, but gave up half way through. Could barely understand her in the lectures. This was summer online class but still would not recommend.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Cabage is a great professor but this online class was a bit heavy on articles. Her quizzes are based on articles, but it is overall an easy class. She does take a bit of time to grade things, but she is a very easy grader and you can always email her if you have questions. She answered my emails fairly quickly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: CRJU 3332 was one of those college classes where you are pretty much doing the work without much help from the teacher. This class, while not exactly difficult, was rather disorganized. All grades weren't put in until the day before they were officially due, and it became confusing in the middle of the semester as to what we were truly learning.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: You will be reading and writing A LOT. Weekly written responses and quizzes based on the book and class lectures. You can find the textbook online for free so don't buy it. She was a little slow with grades because she got sick so we didn't see our grades until the very end of the semester. Just turn in your stuff and you will do fine.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: This class was great at first with lectures, but then the second half of the semester she quit giving lectures and grading assignments. All we did was watch movies the second half and didn't learn anything from them. She didn't grade our assignments until the day before grades were due either. I wouldn't recommend taking her class.

DO NOT TAKE HER. This class was a joke. I did not learn anything all semester. The professor also did not grade anything all semester. She just started graded things at the very end and her grading harshly. This was supposed to be an "easy" class, and it ended up hurting my GPA. Find a professor that will actually teach and not cancel class every.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Classwork was easy and consistent. Attendance was not mandatory and all quizzes and tests were open note and open book online (this semester at least). Slow on grading but provides good feedback. An easy A but I feel like if you are super passionate about the subject you might want a professor who is going to dig a little deeper into the content...
Very easy class, there are two assignments weekly, 1 being a chapter quiz (need the textbook) and another is about the lecture. She is super understanding and I definitely recommend.

Professor Cabage is truly one of the greatest teachers I have had. She teaches about important topics and if you ever have a question you can ask her. Quizzes are very similar to the book so it is important that you have it. Each quiz is 10 questions and you take one every week. Overall this is a great class and I highly recommend it!

At the beginning of the semester she told our class that it would be harder to fail than pass, and she was right. She is extremely knowledgeable and has real experience which she relates topics in class to. Overall an incredible professor and would 100% recommend

My first time taking her and I loved her! Lots of easy in-class assignments. Online quizzes every week, incredibly easy. Two online tests, incredibly easy. I will caution you, though, she takes a long time to grade, and there are a couple of grades missing for assignments I completed. Do NOT skip class, attendance matters. EASIEST A EVER!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She had to miss class a few times, but the class was still interesting. A few group assignments and quizzes over the test. Its a pretty easy class.

I can't say enough great stuff about her, she's great. She is knowledgable about what she teaches and gives life examples/stories to help further understand. She is accessible after class if something happens and you cant complete the hw, all you have to do is ask and she will reopen it. The first professor in a long time that actually cares! 11/10

During my semester, class was cancelled at least 14 times. However, the class was very easy. The final was extremely easy and we only had one test that was online and open book. The homework is soooo easy. She understands we have a lot going on, so it is not a demanding class. I would definitely take this class again. Please take!!

At least for my semester, she canceled class at least once a week. Therefore, it was hard to keep up with what is due and when. At the end, we barely had a final and she opened all old assignments to complete If you missed one. Super easy class, but unsatisfactory as we didn't learn anything.

If you take Cabage for an online class be cautious (this class was senior seminar). There were at least 6 weeks of module assignments that were never uploaded. She never went by the course schedule and I never knew when an assignment would pop up. Most of our grades weren't put in until 3 weeks prior to the semester end. She was just very careless.

Professor Cabage is AMAZING! She is so sweet and talks about her real life experiences as a cop. She makes the class 10000x more interesting. If you have the chance to take her in any class DO IT!!!! You won't regret it.
such an amazing professor. She understands that we all are stressed, and she also cares about what shes talking about. Very knowledgeable. One of my favorite classes.

Professor Cabage is the nicest professor you will ever have. She truly cares about students success and their grades. She is an easy grader and understands as college students we pay a lot of money to be here so her assignments are very straight forwards and easy. Caring is an understatement, she has a lot of crju experience and gives good insight

As a student in Professor Cabage's fall 1101 class, she did not cancel class 20 minutes before class ever. We missed for a conference and a couple other classes, but was given plenty of notice. There was two occasions she canceled class on short notice, but it was an hour or more. She doesn't really lecture, but instead uses active things/groups.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: She is one of the best professors I have ever had, she is extremely kind and knows what she is talking about. She will often talk about previous experiences in law enforcement that she has had, overal great class easy A.

Her online corrections class is the easiest A I have ever received, and I'm a mediocre student. Discussion posts and quizzes weekly, which were super easy. 2 papers, one's your point of view and one's a research paper - I hate writing papers, but both were super easy. 2 test, all questions are from the quizzes.

She is so nice and a great professor! Her lectures were pretty interesting. Tests were pretty easy: multiple choice and some short answers. She took attendance but with the extra credit, you can miss some classes. Class consisted of lectures and watching documentaries. Drops the lowest grade in quizzes, homework, and in-class assignments.
Easy A! Professor Cabage is a real sweetheart. She answers any questions you may and makes the material easy to learn.

I would defiantly take this professor again. She did have a lot of personal issue through the semester but she did manage to stay on top of things. She will work with you if you need extra help. She is very understanding and extremely nice. She did give a lot of assignments but they were super easy. Do the work and you'll do fine.

I took her online criminal justice class and in the beginning, it was really great, but 2018 is not her year. She suffered a lot of personal take backs that caused her not to upload at least 5 weeks of modules. All her quizzes and exams are on Quizlet. There weren't any discussion posts, but we sometimes had short answer assignments.

unorganized. kept running into accidents. her partners father died, so she fell behind on our material (understandable). failed to upload many modules. she said she had an accident during her 10K and suffered a concussion and broken wrist. had to omit exam 2 because we were so behind. but if you dont care about your grades, take her :)

Fantastic professor! Shes educated on the topic and keeps it interesting because she used to be a police officer so she has a lot of stories. Super sweet lady and a very easy and fun class! Highly recommend taking this class if you get the chance

Such an amazing teacher. Her online corrections class is an easy A. A discussion post & quiz weekly, which are easy. The answers for the quiz are in the book, at most itll take 10 minutes for the quiz. You have two papers, one is a reflection over solitary confinement, which was extremely easy. If youre a mediocre student, youll pass with an A.
I took her online for Police in America and it was one of the easiest classes I've ever taken! She always responds to emails within a good time frame and answers questions. Take her!

Amazing professor who cares about her students. Loved all her modules and topics, her feedback is so positive and helps you understand what should be changed next time. Fantastic professor! I loved and enjoyed every minute of this class.

Cancelled a lot of classes this semester, but not a difficult teacher. Homework and (online)quizzes require some reading, but are pretty straight forward. Syllabus stated there are 3 tests, however there was only a midterm and a final. The second half of the semester most assignments were opinion based or extra credit. Go to class, you'll pass.

Professor Cabage is so genuine. She truly cares about all of her students and goes above and beyond for her students. There are some online quizzes that are straight from the textbook so I highly recommend getting the textbook. She loves to have discussions and always tells personal stories that help her students grasp the information! She's great!

This class was perfect if you're not a criminal justice major. She doesn't teach it like everyone is in that major and it's actually really fun. She has a ton of great stories from working in the field and she makes it really worth going! I highly recommend her.
Professor Cabage's class is easy if you show up, participate, and complete the assignments. She cares about her students.
